value.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for Eclipse
value.excerpt: Create a web app in Eclipse and deploy the app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for Eclipse.

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for IntelliJ
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to use Azure to host your Java web apps, built by using IntelliJ IDEA.

value.title: Create and publish a web application with Azure App Service and Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to create and publish webapps to Azure App Service from Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

value.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

value.title: Help remote farmers protect their crops with text message weather alerts using Azure Functions
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll create an application that allows farmers to use text messaging to set up temperature alerts. These alerts can help farmers know when to plant, when to water, or when to protect their crops.

value.title: Share your location as a text message using Azure Functions and Twilio
value.excerpt: Learn how to use location tracking on your phone mixed with Azure Functions and Twilio to share your location with your friends as a text message.

value.title: Refactor Node.js and Express APIs to Serverless APIs with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Refactor Node.js and Express APIs from a server-based architecture to serverless APIs with Azure Functions. Create a new Azure Functions application with TypeScript/JavaScript using Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of creating deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

value.title: Create and publish a static web app with Gatsby and Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Use Gatsby to develop and compile a static web app, then deploy it to the web with Azure Static Web Apps.

value.title: The Mojifier - Create a Slack bot that replaces people's faces with emojis matching their emotion
value.excerpt: Learn how to get images, calculate emotion, match emotions to emojis, and replace faces with emoji.

value.title: Understand Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine cost management
value.excerpt: You'll be able to use the Pricing calculator to assess likely costs, use Azure Advisor to monitor actual costs for Azure resources, implement Spot VMs and Azure Reservations, and describe benefits of Azure Hybrid licensing.

value.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
value.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: 5 Things you didn't know about Azure App Service | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn about 5 things you didn't know about Azure App Service.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: https://azure.com/free
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2CLcw-PXXa4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: An overview of Azure App Service Deployment Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Learn how App Service Deployment Center helps you follow agile development best practices to automate deployments of your code in seconds.  Continuous deployment to Azure App Service https://aka.ms/azfr/532/01  Azure App Service overview https://aka.ms/azfr/532/02  Azure App Service docs https://aka.ms/azfr/532/03
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QdI_BJHMadU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Virtual Machine Serial Console
value.excerpt: Hariharan Jayaraman joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Virtual Machine Serial Console, which allows console access to Azure VMs. This allows you to connect and recover VMs which are in a stuck state due to OS or configuration issues.   For more information:  Azure's Virtual Machine Serial Console
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VUnexr16iCM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Virtual Machine Planned Maintenance
value.excerpt: Ziv Rafalovich joins Scott Hanselman to talk about improvements to the planned maintenance experience in Azure, including better visibility and control of maintenance events that impact virtual machine availability. Learn how to create alerts, discover which virtual machines are scheduled for maintenance,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TXXzFp2TJEQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Deploy your Web App in Windows Containers on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Container support is available in preview in Azure App Service. By deploying applications via Windows Containers in Azure App Service you can install your dependencies inside the container, call APIs currently blocked by the Azure App Service sandbox and use the power of containers to migrate
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Fe_AYBD5m0I" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to add and secure a custom domain on your App Service web app | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video, learn about Azure best practices on how to add a custom domain to your web app and how to secure your custom domain with an App Service Managed Certificate.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: How to configure a backup for your Azure App Service | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to configure a backup for your Azure App Service and Database. value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uQXDkW1pCzs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure and Tips and Tricks series, Craig from the Azure Serial Console team will show you how to get started with the Azure Serial Console on a Linux Virtual Machine. You will learn to configure your VM to get the best Serial Console experience.    For more tips and tricks, visit:

value.title: How to keep your apps healthy with Genie and Navigator in App Service Diagnostics | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Most of the time, your apps are running happily and healthily. However, when things go wrong, you can use Genie and Navigator in App Service Diagnostics to figure out what's wrong. Jen Lee joins Scott Hanselman to show how the App Service Diagnostics interactive interface (Genie) guides you intelligently

value.title: How to manage virtual machine connectivity with the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" series, learn how to easily manage virtual machine connectivity through the Azure Portal. You’ll learn how to manage virtual machine network security groups for virtual network subnets and virtual machines.    Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com/

value.title: How to use GRUB and the Azure Serial Console on a Linux Virtual Machine | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Tips and Tricks series, Ken from the Azure Serial Console team will show you how to enable GRUB on your RHEL VM. You will also learn how to use GRUB to enter single user mode.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips   Get started with 12 months of free services

value.title: How to work with extensions in Azure App Service | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to add extensions to web applications in Azure App Service. Watch to see the list of the various extensions from Microsoft and external parties that you can choose from and how to create your own.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/
